smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain visual elements and text; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases (oval elements) in the Use Case diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with at least one actor, either directly or via include relationships.
No distinct use cases with the same name associated with the same actor were found.
No packages containing multiple model elements with the same name were identified.
The data models (Pages 13-18) appear normalized. Common column names like 'nimetus' appear in different classification tables, but this is consistent naming, not redundant data storage.
All use cases consistently start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
In the State Diagram (Page 9), all states ('Ootel', 'Aktiivne', etc.) are reachable from the Start node via the defined transitions.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 4), all actions are connected via control flows and are reachable from the Start node.
All relationships in the class and database diagrams (e.g., Pages 5, 10, 11) have proper multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1).
No single diagram exceeds the threshold of 10 central elements. The densest diagram (Page 14) contains 9 tables.

On the Class Diagram 'Autode register' (Page 11), the class 'Auto' has 6 visual connection lines to other elements: associations to 'Isik' (registreerija), 'Töötaja' (viimane muutja), 'Auto_mark', 'Auto_kütuse_liik', 'Auto_seisundi_liik', and 'Auto_kategooria' (via the association class 'Auto_kategooria_omamine').
The layout of elements in all diagrams is reasonably uniform; no elements are placed at an excessive distance relative to the average.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
All class, table, attribute, and use case names found are longer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto').
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja').
All attributes and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_aeg', 'nimetus').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Klient', 'Auto_mark').
No type prefixes (Hungarian notation) were found in class, table, or attribute names. Standard PK/FK indicators are allowed.
